spanishExample: ¡Mírame! ¿Quieres que viva ahí?
englishTranslation: Look at me! Do you want me to live there?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
mírame: look at me (Mirar, imperative contraction)
viva: live, I live (Vivir, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿De veras quieren que mires esas cosas?
englishTranslation: Do they really want you to look at those things?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mires: look, you look (Mirar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿De veras quieres que viva ahí?
englishTranslation: Do you really want her to live there?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿De veras? ¿Estás seguro de que ellos tienen la culpa?
englishTranslation: Really? Are you sure(m) they are to blame?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: ¿Estar ahí a las cinco en punto es parte del plan? ¿De veras?
englishTranslation: Being there at five o’clock is part of the plan? Really?
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: ¿Por qué miras eso? Necesitaba tu ayuda.
englishTranslation: Why are you watching that? I needed your help.
vocabIncluded: miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)
necesitaba: needed, I needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: En ese sentido, de veras necesitaba seis de esas cosas.
englishTranslation: In that sense, I really needed six of those things.
vocabIncluded: necesitaba: needed, I needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: En primer lugar, fueron buenos recuerdos, pero ahora vivo aquí.
englishTranslation: In the first place, they were good memories but now I live here.
vocabIncluded: en primer lugar: in the first place (idiom)
vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: En primer lugar, tenemos que pensar en eso.
englishTranslation: In the first place, we have to think about that.
vocabIncluded: en primer lugar: in the first place (idiom)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Es muy seguro de sí mismo porque ha vivido ahí.
englishTranslation: He’s very sure of himself because he has lived there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
seguro de sí mismo: sure of oneself (idiom)

spanishExample: Hay siete personas que quieren ser parte de esa cuenta.
englishTranslation: There are seven people who want to be part of that account.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Lo hiciste seis veces, no tiene sentido.
englishTranslation: You did it six times, it doesn’t make sense.

spanishExample: Mira, tenemos que darnos cuenta de que tienen un plan.
englishTranslation: Look, we have to realize they have a plan.
vocabIncluded: darse cuenta de que: to realize (idiom)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Necesito que lo miren y hablen entre sí.
englishTranslation: I need you all to look at it and talk among yourselves.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablen: speak, they speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
miren: look, they look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No queremos que mire la cuenta.
englishTranslation: We don’t want him to look at the bill.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mire: look, he/she/it look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Puede ser, necesito pensarlo.
englishTranslation: Could be; I need to think about it.
vocabIncluded: necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
pensarlo: to think about it (Pensar infinitive) + CONTRACTION

spanishExample: Puede ser… ¿crees que se dieron cuenta de que yo no estaba?
englishTranslation: Could be… do you think they realized I wasn’t present?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
crees: believe, you believe (Creer, present, 2nd person)
darse cuenta de que: to realize (idiom)

spanishExample: Tenemos muchos buenos recuerdos y por eso me mira así.
englishTranslation: We have a lot of good memories and that’s why he looks at me like that.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
mira: looks, he/she/it looks (Mirar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tienen problemas entre sí, solo dijeron cuatro palabras.
englishTranslation: They have problems among themselves, they only said four words.

spanishExample: Tienen que darse cuenta de que siempre la miran.
englishTranslation: They need to realize that they always look at her.
vocabIncluded: darse cuenta de que: to realize (idiom)
miran: look, they look (Mirar, present, 3rd person plural)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Vamos a hacer de cuenta que necesita nuestra ayuda.
englishTranslation: We’re going to pretend he needs our help.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Vamos a necesitar que lo hagas porque tienes la culpa.
englishTranslation: We’re going to need you to do it because you are to blame.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Vivimos ahí hace tres años, ¿qué necesitas?
englishTranslation: We lived there three years ago, what do you need?
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
necesitas: need, you need (Necesitar, present, 2nd person)
vivimos: lived, we lived (Vivir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Voy a hacer de cuenta que sé esa palabra.
englishTranslation: I’m going to pretend I know that word.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Yo vivía con él, pero él ahora vive por aquí.
englishTranslation: I used to live with him, but now he lives around here.
vocabIncluded: vive: lives , he/she/it lives (Vivir, present, 3rd person)
vivía: lived, I lived (Vivir, imperfect, 1st person)
